CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial (Article 6 - Civil proceedings;Article 6-1 - Access to court);Non-pecuniary damage - award;Respondent State to take individual measures (Article 46-2 - Individual measures)
JUDGES: Egidijus Kūris;Guido Raimondi;Helen Keller;Nebojša Vučinić;Paulo Pinto De Albuquerque;Peer Lorenzen
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in Sombor .
CARDINAL . The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant , a practising lawyer , filed a civil claim with ORG in ORG , seeking payment of fees from a private insurance company ( “ the respondent ” ) for the service rendered on account of a legal fee agreement concluded in DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ordered that payment ( izdao platni nalog ) . The respondent objected to this order .
CARDINAL . On DATE , in the course of a hearing , the respondent filed a counter - claim , requesting ORG to declare the DATE contract null and void .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG decided to join the proceeding initiated by the claim and the counter - claim .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed the payment order of CARDINAL DATE , rejected the applicant ’s claim , declared a part of the contract void and decided that the other part of the contract remained in force .
CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the applicant appealed against this judgment .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG in ORG upheld this judgment on appeal .
CARDINAL . On an unspecified date in DATE , the applicant filed an appeal on points of law ( revizija ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG returned the file to ORG , which had apparently failed to adjudicate a part of the applicant ’s appeal .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG adopted a supplementary judgment ( dopunska presuda ) , rejecting that part of the applicant ’s appeal .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s appeal on points of law ( odbacio reviziju kao nedozvoljenu ) , stating that the applicant was not entitled to lodge it , given that LAW prescribes that an appeal on points of law may only be submitted by an attorney at law , not the plaintiff personally . ORG specified that , according to this LAW , parties to the proceedings had lost the legal capacity to file an appeal on points of law individually , even if they were themselves attorneys at law .
CARDINAL . The decision of CARDINAL DATE was served on the applicant on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged an appeal with ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG requested the applicant to specify his complaint .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant filed his amended constitutional appeal .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s appeal as incomplete .
